intro: Senecio potosinus, commonly known as the Potosí groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh, dry conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Senecio potosinus produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
